data.title: Bangaru Papa (B.N. Reddi) 1955 – Indiancine.ma
data.meta_description:
Director: B.N. Reddi; Writer: Padmaraju Palagummi, B.N. Reddi; Producer: B.N. Reddi; Cinematographer: B.N. Konda Reddy; Editor: M.S. Mani, D. Vasu; Cast: S.V. Rangarao, Kongara Jagaiah, Vinnakota Ramanna Pantulu, T.V. Ramana Reddy, Seshagiri Rao, Dr Sivarama Krishnaiah, T. Krishna Kumari, Jamuna, Vidyavathi, Hemalatha, Seeta, Ramasharma, Vangara Venkata Subbaiah, Kaikala Satyanarayana, V.J. Sharma, Master Ramasagar, Master Venu (Actor), Kanchan, Baby Vijayalakshmi, Baby Seeta Kumari, Jayalakshmi, Leelabai; Duration: 01:19:08; Aspect Ratio: 1.335:1; Hue: 180.000; Saturation: 0.009; Lightness: 0.156; Volume: 0.215; Cuts per Minute: 8.655; Summary: Story: Palagummi Padmaraju from George Eliot’s Silas Marner
The rich Manohar (Jaggaiah) marries the poor Shanta (Jamuna), neglecting to inform his conservative and tyrannical father. The father forces him to marry a girl of his choice, even as Shanta dies in a storm leaving an infant daughter behind. The daughter is rescued by the criminal Kotaiah (Ranga Rao) who, while raising her, becomes a reformed character. Manohar suffers, unable to declare the woman to be his daughter. The melodrama is remembered for Ranga Rao’s performance. A commercial flop though a success among the urban upper class.
